primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of God from the future toward a humanity trapped in a decaying past (the 'Valley of Ashes') to establish an eternal Kingdom.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is on the move toward us

object.identificatie: The Kingdom of God / True Peace / Rescue from the Past
tekstueel_bewijs: The great coming Day of the Kingdom of God

zender.identificatie: The Future of God / The Promise
tekstueel_bewijs: The mouth of the Lord has spoken it
The note is struck; it is sounded from the future
Emmanuel shall come to thee, O Israel
We are met by the oncoming Lord

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Advent Message (Hymns/Angels)
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit breathes life from the dead
As the electrifying message reaches our ears

tegenstander.identificatie: The Past / Nostalgia / Sin / Death (The Valley of Ashes)
tekstueel_bewijs: The past is a destroying current
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but an ontological 'undertow' and 'destroying current' that leads to futility and death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to the coming Kingdom.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Ethical actions (forgiveness, curbing spending, challenging society)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly fueled by the primary: 'Trusting in that promise, we can do things we thought we could not do.'

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Future Promise → The Kingdom → The Church/Hearer
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → God → The Destroying Past

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is on the move toward us.
The Holy Spirit breathes life from the dead.
God is enlisting us on the side of his future.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We beat on, boats against the current.
We try to create artificial worlds of light.

voorbeelden: Advent summons us to... renounce the easy consolations.
If you know your Bible, you will recognize...
We can do things we thought we could not do.
Relying on him, we can change.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) granted by the 'Oncoming Lord' rather than the 'Devoir' (Obligation) of the hearer.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Gatsby's failure) through ~S2 (Artificial Christmas lights) to S1 (The Coming King).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God breaking into the 'destroying current' from the future.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'Valley of Ashes' is presented as an inescapable graveyard without divine intervention.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor who moves toward a passive/incapable humanity. Ethics are presented as a fruit of this divine movement.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the 'We can' section
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We can change our habits... curb our spending.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is on the move toward us, not the other way round.
The past is a destroying current, ready to swallow us up in futility.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (John the Baptist, Mary) are used as recipients of the promise rather than models of behavior.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Mary and Zechariah are actants through whom God's future enters the present.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; the burden of 'creating' peace is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace in the primary program.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Gatsby' metaphor to the Advent theology is seamless and structurally sound.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The oncoming Lord... in the graveyard of dreams, the Holy Spirit breathes life.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) to do what was previously impossible.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'destroying current' and 'incapacity' that traps the human subject.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject and the hearer as the Receiver of a future-oriented salvation.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The transition to 'we can' is well-grounded in 'relying on him'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (The Past/Death) is sufficiently formidable.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's coming) correctly precedes and enables Ethics (Our response).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching. The use of Fitzgerald's imagery serves to deepen the theological diagnosis of the human condition without sliding into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would praise the Gatsby metaphor, Greimassian analysis reveals that the metaphor functions to define the 'Opponent' (The Past) as a cosmic force.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Malachi/Luke link; semiotics shows how these texts function as 'Senders' of a future-oriented value system.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'power' to change (Pouvoir) is an endowment from the Subject (God) to the Receiver, rather than an inherent capacity of the hearer.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap by treating biblical figures as signs of God's action rather than models for human imitation.
